agreement_title: Political Science/Race, Ethnicity, and Politics B.A.

general_information.text: DATED MATERIAL, SUBJECT TO CHANGE. PLEASE CONSULT CURRENT UCSD GENERAL CATALOG FOR ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION. Please visit the Department of Political Science homepage: http://polisci.ucsd.edu. NOTE: Eight areas of concentration are offered. Students are required to take two of the lower-division courses (11-12-13) as well as Political Science 10 and Political Science 30 (PS 30 is not included in the introductory sequence).

UC San Diego Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the links below:Advanced Placement (AP) https://www.ucsd.edu/catalog/pdf/APC-chart.pdfInternational Baccalaureate (IB) https://catalog.ucsd.edu/_files/international-baccalaureate-credits-chart.pdf

requirements.receiving_course_text: POLI 10: Introduction to Political Science: American Politics (4.00 units)
requirements.sending_course_text: POL SC 1: National and California Government (3.00 units)

requirements.receiving_course_text: POLI 11: Introduction to Political Science: Comparative Politics (4.00 units)
requirements.sending_course_text: POL SC 2: Comparative Government and Politics (3.00 units)

requirements.receiving_course_text: POLI 12: Introduction to Political Science: International Relations (4.00 units)

requirements.sending_course_text: POL SC 51: Political Philosophy (3.00 units) (Same as PHILOS 51)
This course must be taken at the university after transfer
